Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
About the job







BIP is the international consultancy for the 21st century with over 5,000 consultants globally daring to make a difference.




Operating at the intersection of business and technology, we design, develop, and deliver sustainable solutions at pace and scale, creating greater value for customers, employees, shareholders and society.




As a Certified B Corporation, we believe in conducting business for the greater good. We embrace all aspects of corporate social responsibility in a way that permeates everything we do, including not only the way we interact with our own people but with our various communities as well as the environment.




BIP. Here To Dare.




About the role




Working hand in hand with our Business Consultants and Data Architects, you will help delivering the finest offerings for analytics, data science and machine learning.




Your Data Scientist role as member of the xTech Centre of Excellence at BIP will involve:




Supporting customers to understand how to improve their businesses using the right AI offerings.
Listening and identifying the client's requirements.
Delivering projects based on our data science offerings.
Interact with software developers and architects internally as part of our global xTech community, with client suppliers and staff
Combine strategic and analytical thinking in relation to business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.




This role is a Hybrid role, the successful person will need to be flexible to travel to client sites as required and have the ability to travel to London 1-2 times per month for team and company events.







Requirements:




Bip UK are a disability confident employer, and we interview every disabled applicant (As defined in the Equality Act 2010) that meets the minimum criteria for the job:




Basic understanding of Data Science and light data development skills—you will need to be able to deliver technical content and at the same time bridge that technical knowledge with business discussions in non-jargon language.
Basic experience in a Data Analytics role (Data Science, Data Analytics or ML).







Additional requirements







Quantitative degree (i.e., Maths, Statistics, Physics, Engineering or Data Science).
A can-do attitude that always puts the customers first and helps gain the position of Trusted Advisor.
Experience working with Agile frameworks is considered a plus.
Experience in Data Visualisation and Data engineering is considered a plus.
Proven experience working with customer data & personalisation
An understanding of and experience with machine learning techniques is considered a plus.
Ability to communicate complex concepts to a broad range of audiences in a simple way
Entrepreneurial spirit & proactiveness







Benefits:




Hybrid working options with monthly budgets for NearU for local office day booking and team meetings.
Bip UK recognises and values its diversity and is committed to offering family-friendly employment policies including enhanced maternity and paternity pay
A diverse and skilled workforce within a collaborative, team-based environment
Profit share and discretionary performance bonus based on personal performance
Comprehensive private medical for staff + Medicash top up plan (option to include dependants)
Employer contribution pension of 6%
25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays and a volunteering day. Also buy up to 5 additional days holiday or sell up to 3 days per year.
Employee Assistance Programme. Company paid 24x7 helpline, online portal and confidential counselling to support staff with any work and / or personal issues
Corporate discounted benefits such as gym and health assessment
Death in service/Life insurance
Eyecare Voucher
Lifestyle change Gift Voucher
Long service reward
Recruitment referral bonus paid for successful referrals
Training and development opportunities to support your career and personal development




*Note the above contains current benefit offerings - these are kept under review and are subject to change or enhancement.




Real world, real work, and real value, that’s the Bip UK commitment on every transformation we do. We deliver good-sense, human-centred strategies, that produce the results. We understand the possibilities can seem endless. Challenges are complex, technology ever evolving, and business goals pressurised and diverse.




Bip UK believes in conducting business for the greater good. We embrace all aspects of corporate social responsibility in a way that permeates everything we do, including not only the way we interact with our own people but with our various communities as well as the environment

Title: Data Scientist
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
At Siemens Mobility, we believe our people are the cornerstone of our success. We are committed to nurturing a supportive and inclusive environment where every team member can thrive. Join our global community, where your growth and development are as important as our shared mission to innovate and transform the Rail industry. Ready to embark on this exciting journey with us?

Siemens Mobility is dedicated to pioneering the future of transportation. Our dynamic team is always exploring new ways to drive innovation and efficiency in rail. We are searching for forward-thinkers eager to make a tangible impact. If you are passionate about creating sustainable and intelligent transport solutions, we want you on our team.

Role Overview:

As a Data Scientist, you will support the operation and maintenance of Siemens Mobility’s UK train fleets, primarily the UK Desiro Classic and Desiro City. This role, preferably based in London (or other UK Siemens Mobility sites), collaborates closely with stakeholders across UK fleet locations to build data-driven solutions for technical, performance, and service management. You’ll deliver impactful data services and prototype solutions, primarily using tools like Spotfire and Grafana, and contribute to Siemens Mobility's AWS-based analytics platforms.

You’ll make a difference by:


Identifying and analyzing support requirements for both internal and external customers.
Defining and implementing data-driven solutions and development plans.
Building prototypes and maintaining visualizations to deliver valuable insights.
Developing platform components and facilitating user analytics.
Working collaboratively with the Siemens Mobility UK team to meet data analytics needs.
Cultivating data science capabilities and sharing expertise across teams.


Your success will be grounded by:


Degree-level knowledge in data science, computer science, or related field.
Experience with visualization tools (e.g., Spotfire, PowerBI, Grafana).
Professional experience developing in Python and SQL.
Proficiency in AWS environments and statistical methods.
Demonstrated success in complex business environments with project management skills.
Collaborative skills and an ability to communicate complex subjects clearly.
Experience in the rail industry and knowledge of train systems (preferred).


You'll benefit from:


Competitive salary
26 days holiday with an option to buy/sell up to 5 days per year
Attractive pension scheme
Subsidized BUPA Healthcare


Create a better #TomorrowWithUs!

We value your unique identity and perspective and are fully committed to providing equitable opportunities and building a workplace that reflects the diversity of society. Bring your authentic self and create a better tomorrow with us!

At Siemens, we promote a growth mindset, the belief that we can learn, grow, and adapt. If you don’t match all the criteria but feel you have transferable skills, we encourage you to apply.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Public Sector - **SC Cleared**
Hybrid Working - 1-2 days in the office a month
£22 per an hour // £162 per a day
6 Months - Starting ASAP




We are seeking a skilled Data Science Practitioner to join a collaborative team working across the Population Statistics, Population Transformation, and Methodology Directorates. This role will play a key role in developing and building census characteristics research datasets as part of the programme, which supports the priority to improve population and migration statistics.




As a Data scientist you will be responsible for;

Develop High-Quality Research Datasets: Collaborate with the Population Statistics and Population Transformation teams to build research datasets that align with programme quality standards. Evaluate and analyze both administrative and survey datasets to identify their strengths and limitations.
Work with multi-disciplinary teams to select and implement the most effective analytical approaches and processes to address user needs.
Lead and manage team members to ensure the use of appropriate tools, techniques, and quality standards, fostering a culture of high performance and continuous improvement.
Provide necessary training, coaching, and mentoring to team members and other staff, supporting their development and ensuring they have the skills needed to excel.




As a Data scientist you will have the following skills and experience;

Applied Mathematics, Statistics, and Scientific Practices: Strong foundation in analytical techniques to interpret and validate data.
Data Engineering and Manipulation: Proficiency in handling and transforming large datasets.
Data Science Innovation: Ability to leverage innovative techniques to solve complex data problems.
Delivering Business Impact: Skills in translating data insights into meaningful business outcomes.
Developing Data Science Capability: Experience in enhancing data science skills and practices within a team.
Ethics and Privacy in Data Science: Strong understanding of ethical considerations and data privacy standards.
Programming and Build (Data Science): Experience in coding and building data science solutions.
Product Delivery Understanding: Knowledge of product delivery processes to ensure seamless project progression.




**SC CLEARED** - Need to hold SC Clearance




Desirable:

Experience with Data Analysis Platform (DAP)
Proficiency in using Git and preparing code for publication

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A unique and exciting opportunity has become available for a Data Scientist within the Group Decision Science team to join the Cabot Group on a permanent basis.

This is a UK based hybrid role, with travel to our London office (EC4N 6HL) required up to 3/.4 times a month.




Job Purpose

This role is for a commercially minded Data Scientist (analyst/senior analyst level depending on experience) in the Group Decision Science team.

Our Decision Science team focus on:

Understanding, measuring, and predicting customer behavior. The team uses both empirical and machine learning techniques to answer questions about customer behaviour in order to optimize collections.

Asset valuation, cash flow and cost projections for portfolios of typically non-performing or distressed assets.




The successful candidate will:

Support the growth of the Cabot business through hands on analytical project work. CCM operates in the UK, Rep. of Ireland, Spain, France, Portugal, Italy and Poland.

Work on projects end to end including data extraction and model development, through to operational delivery.

Support the senior data scientists in planning, presenting projects and making the best use of team resources.

Ensure that our customers and customer experience is forefront in our thinking and how we approach projects.




Key Accountabilities & Responsibilities

Responsible for work streams on projects to deliver statistical and empirical analytics.

Data warehouse interrogation, data collection, sample selection and preparation.

Statistical model building to agreed objectives and deadlines.

Become a subject matter expert on understanding of where our data comes from, how it was created and an appreciation of the context in which was created, covering customer personal data, credit bureau data, transactional data, digital and telephony data.

Over time should be able to develop commercially viable recommendations.

Look for innovation in CCM statistical modelling techniques, which this role would also contribute to.

Understand consumer behaviour relating to the services provided by CCM.

Work with other teams and departments to ensure modelling output is effectively deployed into the business.

Ensure decision science work carried by business units use sound statistical methodologies and team project management standards.

Ensure projects are completed in reasonable timescales.

Champion data quality improvement projects undertaken by the business.

Manage/coordinate resources for the operational implementation of projects.







Knowledge & Experience

Highly numerate and detail oriented.

Good understanding of the retail credit industry lifecycle.

Covering: Acquisition, Customer mgmt. and Collections & Recoveries.

2 years minimum work experience in an analytical role.

Good knowledge of regression/tree-based algorithms.

An appreciation of different modelling techniques and the circumstances in which they apply.

Experience in deployment, auditing and monitoring live models.

Competent using some ETL and statistical software (e.g. SAS, Python, R, SQL).

Awareness of the data protection regulatory framework in the EU (GDPR).

PC literate. MS Excel to a good standard.

Experience in azure or databricks is desirable.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist/ Data Science Manager

Strategy & Insight Consultancy

Central London (Hybrid)

£50- £65,000 + excellent benefits




Innovative and advanced data science techniques help this strategy and insight consultancy’s clients turn data into smart insights. Joining a growing Data Science & Analytics team you will get the chance to work on challenging and diverse analytics projects, collaborating closely with range of clients and stakeholders across the business, advising on best analytical approaches to guide your clients’ decisions.




With strong data analysis, machine learning and statistical modelling expertise you will lead projects across multiple sectors including technology, financial services, public sector, retail, utilities and more. You will be able to showcase your expertise in modelling research survey data, multivariate statistics, segmentation, conjoint analysis and behavioural analysis.




Utilising your strong communication skills, you will also play a central role in coaching and training other talented team members and lead innovative analytical initiatives.




You will bring experience working in data science/ statistics from a market research or media agency, and be an expert in R and/ or Python. Conjoint analysis expertise is a must. Experience of survey analytics such as MaxDiff, TURF; knowledge of machine learning methods, text analytics or organisational analytics would also be advantageous.




Offering a forward thinking, dynamic work environment that encourages an entrepreneurial thinking, this is a fantastic opportunity to progress your Data Science career in an expanding strategic consultancy where you can contribute your expertise to impactful and exciting studies!




To apply or for further information please contact Deborah Lewis, Senior Partner, Resources Group on applytodeborah@resourcesgroup.com or call 0207 242 6321.




Applications will only be considered from those based in the UK with current UK working rights.




About Resources Group




With over twenty five years’ experience helping thousands of Researchers, Insight Specialists and Data Analysts in their career moves, no one has better knowledge of the Market Research, Insights and Marketing Strategy job market than Resources Group. Our consultants take the time to understand your career aims and are dedicated to providing impartial advice and finding you the best career move, with access to an unrivalled range of opportunities with top employers in the sector - visit our website for many more options!




Resources Group’s Diversity and Equality Policy determines that we submit applicants to our clients on the basis of merit and ability, regardless of race, colour, age, disability, family responsibilities, gender, marital status, nationality, religious or political views or affiliations, sexual orientation or socio-economic background

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Scientist

6 Month Contract

UK / London - Remote

An unique opportunity for an experienced Machine Learning Scientist to join a market-leading fintech and help shape customer experience with cutting-end ML models




The Machine Learning Scientist will jump in and work across the full end-to-end lifecycle to create and deploy innovative ML solutions. The Machine Learning Scientist will join a growing product-focused, cross-functional team working on key projects within a customer facing application.




Reporting into the Engineering Director, the Machine Learning Scientist will primarily work on NLP and text-based models, alongside advanced classification techniques and demand forecasting. Collaborating closely with both product and engineering teams, the Machine Learning Scientist will execute well-defined tasks that drive real impact.




Machine Learning Scientist - Key Requirements:

Strong experience in Python and SQL
End-to-end machine learning experience, with a strong focus on modeling and some exposure to deployments
Skilled in NLP and text-based models.
Experience working in product-driven organisations and cross-functional teams.







This is a hands-on role where you'll come in, execute, and make a real impact on customer focused features. If you're ready to tackle some key ML projects, we'd love to hear from you!

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Show more

HTML:
A unique and exciting opportunity has become available for a Data Scientist within the Group Decision Science team to join the Cabot Group on a permanent basis.

This is a UK based hybrid role, with travel to our London office (EC4N 6HL) required up to 3/.4 times a month.


Job Purpose

This role is for a commercially minded Data Scientist (analyst/senior analyst level depending on experience) in the Group Decision Science team.

Our Decision Science team focus on:

Understanding, measuring, and predicting customer behavior. The team uses both empirical and machine learning techniques to answer questions about customer behaviour in order to optimize collections.

Asset valuation, cash flow and cost projections for portfolios of typically non-performing or distressed assets.


The successful candidate will:

Support the growth of the Cabot business through hands on analytical project work. CCM operates in the UK, Rep. of Ireland, Spain, France, Portugal, Italy and Poland.

Work on projects end to end including data extraction and model development, through to operational delivery.

Support the senior data scientists in planning, presenting projects and making the best use of team resources.

Ensure that our customers and customer experience is forefront in our thinking and how we approach projects.


Key Accountabilities & Responsibilities

Responsible for work streams on projects to deliver statistical and empirical analytics.

Data warehouse interrogation, data collection, sample selection and preparation.

Statistical model building to agreed objectives and deadlines.

Become a subject matter expert on understanding of where our data comes from, how it was created and an appreciation of the context in which was created, covering customer personal data, credit bureau data, transactional data, digital and telephony data.

Over time should be able to develop commercially viable recommendations.

Look for innovation in CCM statistical modelling techniques, which this role would also contribute to.

Understand consumer behaviour relating to the services provided by CCM.

Work with other teams and departments to ensure modelling output is effectively deployed into the business.

Ensure decision science work carried by business units use sound statistical methodologies and team project management standards.

Ensure projects are completed in reasonable timescales.

Champion data quality improvement projects undertaken by the business.

Manage/coordinate resources for the operational implementation of projects.



Knowledge & Experience

Highly numerate and detail oriented.

Good understanding of the retail credit industry lifecycle.

Covering: Acquisition, Customer mgmt. and Collections & Recoveries.

2 years minimum work experience in an analytical role.

Good knowledge of regression/tree-based algorithms.

An appreciation of different modelling techniques and the circumstances in which they apply.

Experience in deployment, auditing and monitoring live models.

Competent using some ETL and statistical software (e.g. SAS, Python, R, SQL).

Awareness of the data protection regulatory framework in the EU (GDPR).

PC literate. MS Excel to a good standard.

Experience in azure or databricks is desirable.
